MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY
OF AGRICULTURE AND APPLIED SCIENCE • EAST LANSING
TELEVISION STATION • WKAR-TV
September 9, 1957
Mr. Harry J. Skornia
NARB Headauarters
14 Gregory Hall
Wbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
I will be glad to do the second round of fact sheet documents by September
23rd which I received in the mail this morning. I will be unable to get
the Hurt Mind Study to you by that time. Allow me to explain.
The Hurt Mind is a study of the effects of a BBC educational TV series.
The fact that they have been able to show in a scientific manner that
learning did take place on the part of the general viewing audience as
a result of a typical viewing situation is far more important than the
percentages given in the summary section of the report you handed me.
I have therefore written Mr. Belson for Part Two of the report which gives
his methodology. It is this aspect of the Study which undoubtedly will
be of greatest interest to research people and educators in this country.
As soon as I receive the copy of Part Two you shall have the fact sheet.
Now you can help me. I urgently need a copy of “Measurement Of Meaning11,
the Osgood, Suci, and Tannebaum book published by the TJ. of I. Press.
Since B. T. reviewed it because of the radio and TV experimental results
included in the book, it seems to me that the fact sheet should have a
report on it as well. I am volunteering for the job. Please forward
reviewer's copy at once.
It so happens that I need a copy of this book as a reference in regard to
my own Study of the Political Campaign on TV during 1956. If you cannot
arrange for a reviewer's copy and the subsequent fact sheet report, then
I beg you to buy me a copy obtaining the U. of I. faculty customary JOff*
discount. I promise by all that is holy to return the cost of the book
to you by return mail. I could wait a week if you need to negotiate for
the reviewer's copy. If this is absolutely out of the auestion, please
purchase said copy as soon as may be convenient.
